conversation.content: Good afternoon. My colleague Sarah Chen recommended your service after you helped resolve her account issue last month.
Good afternoon, and thank you for choosing us based on that recommendation. I'm delighted to help you today. May I have your account number or the email address associated with your account?
The email is james.davidson@techcorp.com. I noticed duplicate charges on my statement this morning.
Thank you, Mr. Davidson. I've located your account ending in 4782, and I can see you've been with us since January 2023. Let me review your recent transactions to identify those duplicate charges.
I appreciate that. The charges appeared on March 8th, both for exactly one hundred forty-nine dollars.
I see exactly what you're referring to. There are two charges of $149.00 each, transaction IDs TRX-89234-MK and TRX-89235-MK, both processed at 2:47 PM Eastern on March 8th.
Yes, those are the ones. Should I have been charged twice for my monthly subscription?
Absolutely not. You should only have one monthly charge. I can see this was a processing error on our end when we upgraded our billing system to version 3.2.1 last week.
That explains it. What steps can we take to correct this?
I'm initiating a full refund for the duplicate charge of $149.00, reference number REF-20240312-5KP9. The credit will appear on your account within 24 to 48 hours.
Perfect. Will this affect my service or subscription status in any way?
Not at all. Your subscription remains active through April 8th, 2024, and I've added a note to your account to ensure this doesn't happen during next month's billing cycle.
That's reassuring. Could you send me written confirmation of this refund?
Certainly. I'm sending a detailed confirmation email to james.davidson@techcorp.com right now, which includes your case number CS-7742-QRX and all relevant transaction details.
Excellent. Sarah was right about your customer service being exceptional.
Thank you for that feedback. I'm also applying a 15% courtesy credit, code CARE-0312-VIP, to your next billing cycle for the inconvenience this caused.
That's very generous and unexpected. I really appreciate the proactive gesture.
You're very welcome. Is there anything else I can help you with today? I notice you're on our Professional Plan, and we have a new Enterprise tier launching April 1st if you're interested.
I'll definitely look into that. Thank you for resolving this so efficiently.
My pleasure, Mr. Davidson. Your confirmation email has been sent, and if you have any questions about the refund or the Enterprise plan, please reference case CS-7742-QRX when you contact us.

scenario: hopeful because a friend said customer service was really good here
